com.reactivecascade.reactive

Class PersistentValue<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.reactivecascade.reactive.Subscription<T,T>
      • com.reactivecascade.reactive.ReactiveValue<T>
        • com.reactivecascade.reactive.PersistentValue<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IGettable<T>, INamed, IAtomicValue<T>, IReactiveSource<T>, IReactiveTarget<T>

    public class PersistentValue<T>
extends ReactiveValue<T>
    A ReactiveValue which retains state between stops and starts of the application.

    You must provide a unique name. PersistentValue enforces a singletone per name. If any other persistent value has the same name, they will share value and be the same object. This is an intentional dependency state injection in a flat name space, so pick a naming convention that will make your app debuggable and maintainable.

    TODO Support JSON and/or Serializable and Lists of such arbitrary types TODO Support null as a persisted value by storing a special marker to indicate NOT_ASSERTED and using that to trigger accepting the default passed in. Or something simpler

      • onSharedPreferenceChanged

      • set

        public boolean set(T value)
        Description copied from interface: IAtomicValue
        Set the current value.

        In the case of ReactiveValue which also implements IReactiveSource, which will also trigger all down-chain IReactiveTargets to receive the update. Any associated chain will only fire if the value set is new, not a repeat of a previous value.

        Specified by:
        set in interface IAtomicValue<T>
        Overrides:
        set in class ReactiveValue<T>
        Parameters:
        value - the new value asserted
        Returns:
        true if this is a change from the previous value
